jobs.title: Quality Assurance (QA)
jobs.description:
Role Summary:

We are seeking a seasoned Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a firm understanding of both manual and automated testing, with specific expertise in using the Cypress testing framework. An understanding of performance testing using Locust would be a great plus. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the high quality and optimal performance of our software products prior to release.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and execute detailed manual and automated test cases and scripts using Cypress.
  • Evaluate product functionality and create test strategies and test cases to assess product quality.
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs to resolution.
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers and product managers) to identify system requirements and ensure consistent project execution.
  • Utilize Locust to perform performance testing and analyze results, identifying any performance issues and suggesting optimizations.
  • Develop, maintain, and continuously improve processes, systems, measurement practices, and metrics reporting for the QA function.
  • Work collaboratively within the team to promote innovative quality practices and methods.

Required Qualifications and Skills:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in software quality assurance, including both manual and automated testing.
  • Proficient with Cypress, with a clear understanding of how to create test cases and scripts.
  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve issues creatively and independently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated with strong organizational skills and a keen attention to detail.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with performance testing, ideally using the Locust testing tool.
  • ISTQB certification or any other related software testing certifications.
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.


Location: Remote, Pune, India

jobs.title: Rust Developer
jobs.description:
Location: Remote (US timezone)

Salary Range: $100,000 - $150,000 + Stock Options


Company Overview:

OpenObserve is a leading player in the world of open source observability tools, backed by renowned venture capitalists such as Nexus Ventures and Dell Technologies Capital. With our unique offering of combining logs, metrics, and traces into a single platform, we've made our mark in the tech industry. We are the only tool that comes with a single binary that enables anyone to get started in less than 2 minutes. OpenObserve is proudly a fully remote team with team members spread across the globe.


Role Overview:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Rust Developer to join our fast-growing team. This role will focus on enhancing and expanding our single-platform tool. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a remote work environment, is comfortable with the fast-paced nature of a growing startup, and is located within the US timezone.


Responsibilities:

  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient Rust code to enhance our observability tool.
  • Work with the OpenObserve team to design and implement new features and services.
  • Provide technical guidance and insight to team members and stakeholders.
  • Maintain and improve the performance of existing software.
  • Develop comprehensive testing suites to ensure the reliability and consistency of our software.
  • Collaborate with the team to manage and prioritize project components.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience as a Rust developer.
  • Familiarity with open-source projects and the open-source community.
  • Strong understanding of distributed systems and observability tools.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
  • Able to meet deliverables and drive your work to completion within specified timelines.
  • Great communication skills and the ability to work well with a remote, distributed team.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with log, metrics, or trace observability.
  • Knowledge of other programming languages like Go, Python, or JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) practices.


Benefits:

  • Fully remote position.
  • Competitive salary range: $100,000 - $150,000.
  • Stock options.
  • The opportunity to work with a high-growth, groundbreaking technology company.

OpenObserve is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
